history.content: The 47s are bridge courses, meaning that they part of the content for other courses if you have done some but not all of the course in some other way. They are offered every semester. 47E is the bridge course for EECS 16B, and to take it, you would need to talk with the 16B instructor, Anant Sahai, and have him approve your taking it. You would work out with him (or with one of the other bridge course instructors) how many units you will take and what you will do to complete the course. All courses for the L&S CS major need to be taken for a letter grade in any semester that doesn't have an exceptional policy like this one does, so if you took it in Fall, you would need to take it for a letter grade.

Are we still offering EE47E for Fall 2021? I checked berkeleytime and found it was only offered last semester but not this one? If we still are offering, how would EE47E's syllabus be and how it would be graded (could it be taken PNP for the l&s cs major req)? Thanks!
history.subject: EE47E
